intro: Sphaerocephalus integrifolius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is well-known for its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Sphaerocephalus integrifolius is a popular houseplant due to its ability to bloom year-round under proper care.
